text: Joy Bhadra Hagjer (1914–1973) was an Indian politician. He held many portfolios in the Assam Legislative Assembly. During the period of his demise, he was undivided Assam's Minister of Veterinary, Jails and Minority Affairs as on 18 July 1973. He belongs to the indigenous Dimasa community. He was honoured being founder president of Bodo Sahitya Sabha as its President.Bodo Sahitya Sabha and there are also some colleges in the state named after him. ==Early life and education== Joy Bhadra Hagjer was born in the tiny village named Nanadisa located near Haflong.
